SENT.plain: Ectopia lentis may cause a reduction in visual acuity, which varies with the type and degree of dislocation and the presence of other ocular abnormalities
Retinoscopy may reveal a significant refractive error, usually myopia and astigmatism
Occasionally, an accurate refraction may be difficult because of tilting or dislocation of the lens
If aphakic refraction improves visual acuity, an aphakic correction should be considered
